title: Lima City Tour from the Port of Callao For Cruises
description: Don't let confusing public transit, overpriced taxis, or lack of time keep you from exploring the wonders of Lima. This Lima city tour is specifically designed for passengers disembarking at the Port of Callao and includes a private van and professional guide to help you see the city's highlights, from its UNESCO-listed center to its famous cafes.
all_descriptions: Don't let confusing public transit, overpriced taxis, or lack of time keep you from exploring the wonders of Lima. This Lima city tour is specifically designed for passengers disembarking at the Port of Callao and includes a private van and professional guide to help you see the city's highlights, from its UNESCO-listed center to its famous cafes.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Centro Historico de Lima, Plaza de Armas, Lima 15001 Peruwe will walk through some streets and the guides will tell us their history and traditionDuration: 30 minutesStop At:Museo Convento San Francisco y Catacumbas, Jiron Ancash, Lima 15001 Peruwe will visit the catacomb museumDuration: 40 minutesStop At:El Parque del Amor, Malecon Cisneros 18, Lima PeruBeautiful love park in the district of MirafloresDuration: 20 minutesStop At:Plaza de Armas (Plaza Mayor), Jr. Junin and Jr. Carabaya, Lima PeruFrom this beautiful square we can see from the outside the cathedral of Lima, the government palace, the arzobizpal palace and its beautiful fountain of water that was built in the sixteenth centuryDuration: 35 minutesStop At:PERÚ GOURMET, Pje. Sta. Rosa 153, Lima 15001, PeruWe will have 45 minutes to eat something typical in this good restaurant, the food is not included.We will also have a demonstration of how to make a ceviche (typical dish of Lima) and we will also prepare a Pisco Sour (typical drink of Peru)Duration: 55 minutesStop At:Plaza San Martin, Av. Nicolas de Pierola cdra. 9, Lima 15001 PeruBajaremos pocos minutos en esta bella plaza para tomar fotos y ver lindas edificación muy antiguas.Duration: 15 minutesStop At:Mercado nro 1 de Surquillo, Av. Paseo de la Republica, Lima PeruPodremos descubrir por que el Peru es considerado las mejores comidas del mundo , podremos ver vegétale y frutas típicas del Peru , tendremos unos minutos libres para explorar este bello mercado típico.Duration: 20 minutes

Great Lima Experience

Nov 2024 • Couples
Marco and his team were awesome. Initially there was some confusion on our part as to where we were to depart from but that got clarified and then the tour was seamless
We were a group of 3 couples so it made hearing the historical information and interacting easy. Lima is a beautiful city and we saw many diverse highlights; including the President’s motorcade returning to the palace!

Estero, FL359 contributions

Amazing Tour

We had one day to see Lima and our money was well spent. This tour was amazing in terms of the itinerary and transportation. While other members of our Norwegian Cruise was stuck in small vans, we were comfortable in our air conditioned large van. The tour guides were informative and went out of their way to make us all feel comfortable. We highly recommend.
Written January 15, 2024

jmathews6546
Sarasota, FL32 contributions

Wonderful Site Selections, Presentation of them, Service.

Jan 2020 • Couples
My wife and I were on a cruise that stopped in Lima. We found the cruise ship tours did not really cover Lima well, found Discover Lima and booked with them. The group was in a van with two guides, (we had Andrew and Julio) so each stop was with a small group. The Old City stops were great, and we got to see the Inca Market, The Park of Love, and Miraflores as well, all in one comfortable and we'll explained tour. We could all ask questions and get answers both on the ride and walking portions, due to the small size, and this added greatly to the experience. Everyone on the tour enjoyed the whole experience and were congratulating themselves for having found the tour.
Written January 22, 2020
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
hywheeler
Eastbourne, UK75 contributions

Great Day Out in Lima

Apr 2019 • Friends
We had booked a city tour of Lima with Lima Discovery and our guide Mabel met us at the shuttle bus stop where we transferred to a minibus.

Our first stop was a square in the centre of Lima where we stopped to take photos. We drove a bit further then got out of the minibus for a walking tour.

We walked to St Peter's church which is built in the style of Seville Cathedral and very beautifully decorated.

Then it was a short walk to the church of St Francis. The church used to be a monastery and after viewing the church and the library we went to see the catacombs. These lie beneath the church and house the bones of the monks who died there. Originally the monks were buried in the ground and when their bodies had decomposed they were dug up and their bones were separated and collected into types. They were then displayed in cases and boxes.

Leaving the church of St Francis, we walked through the government district to the central square. The tour then stopped at a local restaurant for lunch.

After lunch we boarded the minibus again and drove for about 40 minutes to a local artisan market where we bought some souvenirs. Then it was back to the bus. A visit to the Love Park on the coast rounded off a very good tour.
Written April 25, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Conni B
Cerritos, CA6 contributions

Lima City Tour

Mar 2019 • Couples
This tour was an okay look at the city of Lima. The process of getting assigned to our guide and bus was a bit long and confusing. However our guides Mabel and Jaime were wonderful, informative, helpful and knowledgeable. Lima is a city of lots of traffic, and we spent a lot of time in the bus getting from one site to another. Our lunch at a restaurant in the center of town was delicious, but took way too long to get our group served and get back on our way. It isn't the tour company's fault that Lima is so crowded, and we did get to see the city much more cheaply than through the cruise ship's excursions.
Written April 1, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Folkestone, UK51 contributions

Great tour

Wilcox our guide met us at the mall where the shuttle bus from the ship dropped us. He was on time, spoke fluent English and was very knowledgeable. He took us to a good restaurant for lunch (Not included, but good value) he and Jaime our driver were great people to spend a day with. I would recommend this tour it was the same tour as the ship offered but far less costly.
Written February 24, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Annette P
Springfield, MO160 contributions

Discover Lima shore excursion

Took Discover Lima as a shore excursion. We had gotten a warning letter in our cabin about how dangerous it was outside the port area so we were a little concerned about having to meet outside the area but it turned out to be fine since there were taxis & other people. The cruise ship was so concerned they took passengers to a mall away from the port to drop them off. We weren't sure if we should go to the mall or outside the port. It took us a while to get the van so we were standing outside for a long time. The tour was in a van so that was nice to have fewer people. It was a typical city tour to see the sights. Nothing outstanding sticks in my mind. Our tour guide didn't provide much information about the culture just city information. Uninspiring tour.
Written November 10, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
DocSavage01
Dallas, TX4 contributions

What a FANTASTIC tour!

Sep 2018 • Solo
I was fortunate enough to book with Lima Discover, and could not recommend them highly enough. My guide was Vilko, and he made it one of the best tours I have ever taken. I would ask for him, if at all possible. Even though I booked during the high season for cruise lines coming through, I was the only one who booked for this day, so it was essentially a private tour.

Vilko arrived at my AirBnB precisely on time, and proceeded to chauffeur me to any of the highlights of Lima that I was interested in. The whole time, he also provided a fascinating running commentary on the growth and history of the city, the different types of neighborhoods, the people, the traffic, etc. He also tailored his topics to those in which I am interested, which made it even better. We visited the most important churches and historic buildings in the City Center, where we also looked in at museums/shops featuring varieties of pisco, coffee, and chocolate (heaven!). He was also able to time our passing near the Presidential Palace in time to see the changing of the guards. Next we walked around part of the beautiful neighborhood of Barranco where he explained much of its history and characteristics, and we took a short break to sip coffee at a wonderful Barrancan cafe. Finally, we sampled the market in Miraflores where Vilko explained many of the different fruits, vegatables, etc., most of which I had never even heard of. Finally, he dropped me off at my place after a very satisfying 6 hours of touring.

What was remarkable was that Vilko knew so many of the people we came across. He is obviously intimately familiar with the city. (In addition to being fluent in English and Spanish, he also seems to speak German.) Finally, he made the wonderful gesture of putting me in contact with one of his many contacts in the city about a possible real estate deal.

Overall, I whole-heartedly recommend Lima Discover's Lima City Tour from Port of Callao to anyone who wants to see a broad swath of Lima in one day, and especially with Vilko. He is extraordinary!
Written September 3, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Ursulafay
Olympia, WA129 contributions

Lima City Tour-very nice and thoughtful guide

Mar 2018 • Friends
We took the shuttle from the cruise ship terminal to San Miguel Mall to meet our guide and driver. Ismael (guide) and Ricardo (driver). He took us to the Monastery of San Francisco church. Originally he was going to take us to Mira Flores and Baranca neighborhoods, but since we saw all that the day before we didn’t want to repeat, so he graciously changed our agenda to ensure we saw the most we could.

While we were driving he told us about Lim and also about a lot of health products (he was a nutritionist) that are natural products and he had samples.

At the Monastery it was Palm Sunday so lots of people were in church each carrying a unique palm feature. The monastery contained a catacomb system under the church that was unique. We toured it, but were not allowed to take pictures anywhere in the church. About 25,000 people were buried in the catacombs but no bodies, just a bunch of bones and no markers. Apparently that is the way it was done years ago.

We also toured the monastery and that was very interesting. Also not allowed to take pictures. The most fascinating part was the library which contained about 20,000 volumes of books each one hand written. It was huge and absolutely beautifully maintained.

The monastery was itself was enormous and there are still about 130 monks that are there. Since it was Palm Sunday the church was crowded because many in Peru are still very religious. Our guide paid our entrance fee of $5 each which was not in our program. Again the Catholic Church was huge and most of the individual alters were ornate as usual, with lots of gold leaf. And again the normal citizens very poor. The average monthly income is $280 US$ a month. Which is not very much. Most cannot afford to raise a family with that little income.
Written May 10, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
